metaData.title: Attractions and hiking or biking trails in Rosia Montana
metaData.description: Trails on areas (from historic center and roman galleries up to the top of the mountains). Thematic trails (mining evolution, the protests, rural life). You can also book guided tours, rooms, bikes, camping in Rosia Montana, Alba, Apuseni Mountains, Transylvania, Romania.

specificArticles.textContent:
We are located in Roșia Montana, Carpathian Mountains, Transylvania, an area with fantastic landscapes due to the mountains, valleys and the lakes around us, but also with a rich heritage because of the buildings, galleries and mining areas built by the various civilizations who came here to extract gold. Discover all this through the hiking or biking trails bellow. Each trail has images, description and online maps with GPS data, so they can be access from any device during your journey.
The icons from each trail means: - hiking trail | - biking trail | - the destination can be also reach by car
These trails contains the attractions from Roșia Montană.
These trails contains the attractions around the Roșia Montană.
We organize the following guided thematic trails, to discover more about the stories, the past and the present of Rosia Montana:

The mining evolution trail - will start with the old mining story of Rosia Montana by visiting the Antic galleries made by Agathyrsi with fire and water, then we will continue with the rectangular galleries made by romans with the chisel and hammers and will see the installations made for processing the golden ore like the stamps mills and the man made lakes. We finish by visiting the mining plants, wasting ponds and open pits made recently by the the communist, which shaved the mountains and covered the Geamana village with mining wastes.

The mining protests trail - we go along the areas where protests were held for or against the gold mining project proposed by the Canadian company in 2007, that wanted to transform the village in a big open pit. We will discuss about what happened there and what would have been the consequences of implementing such a project in the area. In the end we will watch at Casa Petri some movies with the streets protests from 2014, organized in the country and abroad, against this project.
